reviews.review: MUY ENTRETENIDO SI TE GUSTA LA EMOSION

So I've come to that point where I need to update my old review because this game is slowly going down hill. 

I started playing this game after pig's release, my hours may not be big, but I've played long enough to the point I've been through the exhaustion nerf the the DS 25% wiggle to get out, to the Juggle the survivors.

With over most of my hours played normal res (1.1k hours) I've resulted to playing in another res.



1. the lazy devs
This game is completely killer sided and I don't care what others say im staying to this point.
Dead zones on multiple maps making it near impossible to play.

2. Bad decision making for the health of the game.
the develops have their priority in the wrong place, they keep adding these ranged killers to the game which (depending who you ask) in boring we currently have post pin head being released have 3 ranged killers in a row.  

3. Bad decision making pt2
please please stop bring out chapters  and focus on making the game balanced and bug fixes hit boxes are fuckin' broken and for my console cousins is unplayable 

4. Tunneling 
Tunnelling is still a big problem and destroys this game.

Juego entretenido con infinita variantes de perks/habilidades para combinar en cuanto a jugabilidad lo encuentro muy bien, con algunos bugs es cierto y algunos mapas por ahi mal optimizados pero no le saca merito a lo logrado por la desarrolladora.Los dlc me parecen bastante buenos con su respectivo survivor y killer.En cuanto a la comunidad la encuentro algo mal por el tema del circulo vicioso que hay entre genrushers y killers camperos. Si campeas de killer la premade te va a genrushear, entonces genrushean a otro y dicho sujeto empieza a tunnelear o cargar con noed y asi sucesivamente y la verdad actualmente jugar killer es dificil ya que el unico objetivo que tienen los survivor es genrushear. Quitando eso de lado es un buen juego entretenido en el cual todavia se puede encontrar partidas bastante movidas que te pongan tenso a la hora de hacer las skill checks sabiendo que un error puede condenarte la partida y mas si el killer le mete presion a los survivors. Lo habia abandonado en 2017 y ahora que lo retome y aprendi a jugar puedo decir que dejando los genrushers y los killer camperos/tunneleros de un lado el juego en si es divertido y muy recomendado

I love this game. It's really fun. I mostly play survivor but I'm getting ready to start playing killer soon. This game is very objective based which makes it easy to learn and understand how to play. That being said, I don't find it too repetitive because of the multiple maps, the fact you are always playing with new people and you don't know what kind of players they are. I love that you play online with other players and that you can make custom games with friends to practice different perks and characters. Sometimes there are some toxic behaviors of players that kind of kill the fun of the game, survivors who don't do any objectives or help when you are on the hook, or spend their time harassing the killer, or killers who camp out once they have hooked you and use you for bait, or just wait around for you to be unhooked just to down you again, or down you but don't hook you even though you are the last survivor and just waste your time bleeding out instead of finishing the game. You won't find any online multiplayer games without some toxic players so there's not much that can be done about that. I can say I have met some really fun gamers through DbD and overall am really happy with the community. As someone that really is only a year into PC gaming, this game is the first game I can say I have put a lot of hours into and am still happy to play any time.

I picked the game up on release 4 years ago but didn't play it a hell of a lot, maybe 60 hours, 4 years later I have tried to get in to it, put about 300 hours as mostly killer, so lot of waiting time in there rather than playing. Played a fair amount of survivor also though to get challenges done.

I would not recommend this game to new players at all, I am stuck in an addiction loop to level up killers at this point though which keeps me playing with the fun level just enough to keep me playing, although I question why I don't move on to something else many many games.

The majority of my opposition have been playing it an extremely long time, and more than half are playing with friends using comms. More than half the games involve some kind of abuse or include people going out of their way to hurt your enjoyment. It seems to have become standard for many (on both sides) to play and act towards the other side with complete sociapathy. This is down to the games mechanics completely, but players will blame their opposition.

It is very possible for experienced survivors to bully a relatively inexperienced, or less skilled killer, and for killers it's even easier to play in a way that means the survivors have a bad time, players (killers more than survivors) are expected to actively play in a way to be generous to the other side which often conflicts with the optimal way to win and if you don't there will be tons of abuse and mocking.

Playing as survivor I meet a lot of killers that are playing in a deliberate fashion to annoy the survivors, I think there is such a large amount of meeting the nasty teams that are deliberately trying to be ♥♥♥♥♥ that they then take it out on everyone. So unless you are playing in an experienced team you have to write off a lot of games as not fun and jump in to another one hoping to find the occasional fun game.

As a Killer you need an even thicker skin because many survivors only see things from their own perspective, even if you play completely by the rules that survivors believe you should play by there is still a large amount of them that will abuse you because they will see some invented 'rule break' because they lost and it's easier on their ego if they can be angry at you about something. This converts in to lots of comments deliberately intended to be hurtful.

The matchmaking is so ineffective that there may as well be none, you can be a brand new player going against a team of players working together on voice comms that know every inch of what maps can look like, and the next game you are going against 4 individuals who don't know how the killer even works.

The largest problem is that the power difference between an experienced team working on comms compared to a team of individual players is extremely large. Even if the individuals have tons of experience it only takes 1 or 2 to be less skilled or experienced and it makes it much easier for the killer. The game makes no effort at all to balance this. This will lead to players putting the blame squarely on the opposition or their team mates in the majority of cases, and I believe this is the root of the level of nastiness that occurs.

Hi; so this game is a great concept but I do have to say there are some really bad qualities to the game. First off; the camping. When we report a killer for camping we get a message that says "Camping isn't an acceptable report" or something along those lines. I think it's quite dumb really because you can win any DBD match as a killer if you hook and then stay there so nobody else unhooks them. When the survivors try to help unhook; the killer can easily down them and wait for them all to be down in order to hook them all and win. I think it's a very very low blow. I've had multiple occasions where I message the chat after the round is up and call out the killer as a camper and they blow up saying stuff like "Nah, you just suck". I find it really annoying when playing as a killer; I'll hit a player with whatever weapon and sometimes it doesn't hit even though I know it should've. I also think adding a chat feature within the matches will help survivors win better when camper killers are in match. I think more types of activities should be added as well because you do 4 main things in a match: Fix generators, help survivors whenever they need help, open the door to escape, and destroy totems. That's literally it. So; YES I love the game and it's concept but for every step forward there's always like 4 steps backwards.
This game gives me the big sad when I play either side, but overall I recommend to people.

Dead by Daylight has been a game i've played off and on for years. By the time of this review, it is the fourth anniversary. This game is a mixed bag. This game, like most other games, is fun when you have a group of friends to play with. The amount of fun you have though is dependent on the players you come across. Usually the game isn't too annoying in general. Sure the developers do some wrong things that tick off the community, but they try to fix it if they can. They aren't afraid to rework a character, which is amazing. Back to players though... my goodness, the amount of toxic people you will meet is awful. If you wipe a team, they'll be quick to call stuff like leaving a player on the ground. All killers do this at some point, so more than others. The survivors are way worse with this than the killers. Survivor handbook being a common meme. Killer can also be toxic by face camping, proxy camping + targeting. It's ridiculous at no matter what rank, and isn't fun to deal with. There's plenty of fun moments you can have with this game on both sides. Though one bad game like that can just sometimes ruin your flow. If you have friends who you can team up with and pull off some sick games, or have the time to master a killer or two and slash down survivors, this game is for you. I recommend this game, but i'd say wait until they put it on sale. Which is very common, and shouldn't be too long. Dead by daylight gets a 7/10.
